TEXT.P: Data--like that shown in this table--forms the core of all scientific inquiry. Scientists look for trends in data, then attempt to explain those trends. These possible explanations lead to new experiments, which then lead to new discoveries and new questions. Scientists use graphs to make it easier to see trends in data.
